revisions.rev:
The '''intrascleral plexus''' is the network of [[blood vessel]]s within the substance of the [[sclera]]. [[Blood]] enters from the small connecting channels from Schlemm's canal; it exits through superficial vessels, then passing it on to the [[anterior ciliary veins]].<ref>"eye, human."EncyclopÃ¦dia Britannica from [[EncyclopÃ¦dia Britannica 2006 Ultimate Reference Suite DVD]] 2009</ref>
